intro: Phialacanthus wrayi, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs. The botanical features of Phialacanthus wrayi make it a unique and ornamental plant in both natural and cultivated settings.
